@title:Season 20 Guardian Games weapons
@description:Lightfall Guardian Games weapons with Classy Contender origin trait

// The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons ðŸ˜‰). Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,4071163871,3708227201

// The Title (PvE backup roll)
// (Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds), (Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion), Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons ðŸ˜‰). Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong, or Perpetual Motion provides useful, if smaller, boosts as an alternative choice. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

@title:Season 20 Guardian Games weapons
@description:Lightfall Guardian Games weapons with Classy Contender origin trait

// The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for void synergy minor add clear in general activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons ðŸ˜‰). Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. For void synergy, in the second column signature perk slot, Repulsor Brace provides a void overshield on void debuffed enemy kills - very useful for keeping you alive in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,4071163871,776531651

Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong, or Perpetual Motion provides useful, if smaller, boosts as an alternative choice. For void synergy, in the second column signature perk slot, Repulsor Brace provides a void overshield on void debuffed enemy kills - very useful for keeping you alive in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. // The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general activities for melee builds. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons ðŸ˜‰). If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. Then, the tried and true combination of Pugilist in the first trait column as the support perk and Swashbuckler in the second as the signature perk is great for melee builds. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,691659142,4082225868

// (Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds), (Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion), Surrounded

Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in general activities for melee builds. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected (maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons ðŸ˜‰). If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=4090651448,1561002382,691659142,4082225868

// Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel takes it to a manageable 84. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,106909392,1354429876,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3230963543,1354429876,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvE backup roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Zen Moment, Fourth Time's The Charm), Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). If you're still finding the recoil difficult, you can proc all 5 stacks of Zen Moment with just three hits, in the first trait column as your support perk. If you're not finding it a problem, than Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,106909392,2387244414,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,106909392,2387244414,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,3230963543,2387244414,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,3230963543,2387244414,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,106909392,1354429876,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,106909392,1354429876,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,3230963543,1354429876,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,3230963543,1354429876,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Fourth Time's The Charm, Outlaw), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,106909392,1354429876,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3230963543,1354429876,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,106909392,1168162263,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3230963543,1168162263,831391274

// Taraxippos (PvE backup roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Zen Moment, Fourth Time's The Charm. Outlaw), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed (and an extra shot for Tac Mag). If you're still finding the recoil difficult, you can proc all 5 stacks of Zen Moment with just three hits, in the first trait column as your support perk. If you're not finding it a problem, than Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,106909392,2387244414,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,106909392,2387244414,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=3661387068,3230963543,2387244414,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=1467527085,3230963543,2387244414,831391274

@title:Season 20 Neomuna weapons
@description:Season of Defiance Neomuna weapons with Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds work well. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column and Opening Shot as the signature perk in the second will push range out to 98 (which is just shy of 40m) and add aim assist and accuracy bonuses with your first shot with both perks procced, and still keep 78 range (36.6m) and a smaller bump to accuracy for subsequent shots with Keep Away. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,47981717

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds work well. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column pushes out range to 78 (36.6m) and a bump to accuracy when procced. Finally, as your second column signature perk, Elemental Capacitor paired with an arc (+50 Handling) or void (+20 Stability) subclass round out the stats to either make it snappier or for easier follow-up shots and reduced flinch. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Under Pressure, Harmony
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. Harmony as your second trait column signature perk will both boost handling and two-tap (2c) up to 5 resilience, up to 8 with one Surge mod or any resilience with two - the damage boost will also apply to the mini-rocket. There are a few first trait column support perks that you can pair, but Under Pressure (if you're swapping between weapons you're more likely to be towards the bottom of the mag) is probably the most useful. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,1645158859,438098033

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Under Pressure, Harmony
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for M&KB kill-chaining. Shapeable. With Surge mods x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a not damaging stability, to resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. Harmony as your second trait column signature perk will both boost handling and two-tap (2c) up to 5 resilience, up to 8 with one Surge mod or any resilience with two - the damage boost will also apply to the mini-rocket. // Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Killing Wind, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a classic kill-chaining roll, Killing Wind as your support perk in the first trait column, and Kill Clip as the signature perk in the second are a classic combination, improving gunfeel and then two-tapping up to 9 resilience when procced. Any damage boost on top (such as Radiant, of a Surge mod) will two-tap any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. // Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, (Keep Away, Under Pressure), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining and Strand synergy. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a kill-chaining roll that builds into the Strand toolbox, as your support perk in your first trait column, either Keep Away (adding range and accuracy at noral HC engagement distances) or Under Pressure (improving gunfeel towards the botton of the mag) have their place, together with Hatchling as the signature perk in the second column. Thread of Evolution improves Threadlings so anyone hit by one can be two-tapped at any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Headseeker
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range and stability up with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 80 (that's 39.46m ADS-ed) and 61 respectively, and take the Recoil Direction to 95 with a Counterbalance mod. Enhanced Keep Away as your first trait column support perk takes the Range to 90 (40.77mm ADS), and boosts accuracy and, while Headseeker as the second column signature perk doesn't reduce TTK at all, but the additional Aim Assist will make the 0.67s TTK with 5 crits and a body shot for resiliences of 8 or less easier to hit. It also means you'll two burst with one body and two crits at resiliences up to 7. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,460017080

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Extended Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Headseeker
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range, stability and recoil direction up with Extended Barrel (even at the cost of a -10 Handling penalty) and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 83 (that's 39.85m ADS-ed), 54 and 90 respectively, and then take the Recoil Direction to 100 with a Counterbalance mod. Enhanced Keep Away as your first trait column support perk takes the Range to 93 (41.16mm ADS), and boosts accuracy and, while Headseeker as the second column signature perk doesn't reduce TTK at all, but the additional Aim Assist will make the 0.67s TTK with 5 crits and a body shot for resiliences of 8 or less easier to hit. It also means you'll two burst with one body and two crits at resiliences up to 7. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1467527085,1885400500,3619207468,460017080

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Tunnel Vision, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range and stability up with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 80 (that's 39.46m ADS-ed) and 61 respectively, and take the Recoil Direction to 95 with a Counterbalance mod. For kill-chaining, the classic combination of Tunnel Vision in the first trait column as your support perk and Kill Clip as your second column signature perk increases aim assist by 20 and boosts accuracy, and reduces TTK to 0.6s (4c, 1b) for reloading after a kill. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2946784966,1015611457

// Synchronic Roulette (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Envious Assassin, Cascade Point
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Lowish stats by comparison with other precision SMGs, in particular Range, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. Precision SMGs have a 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and 2 body shots and a slowish Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.9s (5c, 5b). It should be fairly easy to control as a precision-frame SMG, so push out the range as far as you can with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds, and a range Masterwork - all of those will get you to 78 which equates to 20.57m in-game. You could make an interesting kill-chaining swap weapon with Envious Assassin in the first trait column as your support perk and then Cascade Point in the second as your signature perk. Each kill adds 3 to the mag after you swap, and reduces TTK to a speedy 0.56s (7c, 2b). Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=811403305&perks=202670084,1885400500,968510818,3751912585

// Synchronic Roulette (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Pulse Monitor, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Lowish stats by comparison with other precision SMGs, in particular Range, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. Precision SMGs have a 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and 2 body shots and a slowish Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.9s (5c, 5b). It should be fairly easy to control as a precision-frame SMG, so push out the range as far as you can with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds, and a range Masterwork - all of those will get you to 78 which equates to 20.57m in-game. You are never going to make an Immortal out of Synchronic Roulette, but the combination of Pulse Monitor in your first trait column as your support perk and Target Lock as your second column, signature perk will mean that, while you're out of cover firing at a target with Target Lock, which cuts TTK to 0.7s (7c, 1b), if you are taking damage from return fire you'll get a refilled magazine and a +50 boost to Handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=811403305&perks=202670084,1885400500,972757866,365154968

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Kickstart
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Using Arrowhead Brake and a Counterbalance mod takes the Recoil Direction to a far more controllable 92 and bumps up Handling to 62, while a combination of Projection Fuse and a Range Masterwork pushes range out to 16.2m while ADS-ed. In the first trait column as your support perk, Under Pressure should be procced constantly which will add 30 stability to make the recoil easier to control and add accuracy to the bolts, and then as your second column signature perk, Kickstart reduces the TTK to 0.63s by applying a 0.8 scalar to charge time. Any additional damage boost (such as Radiant) will drop to TTK to 0.6s with only six bolts needed to kill at 10 Resilience. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=839105230,2969185026,1645158859,1754714824

Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. // Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Well Rounded, Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. With enough range on a fusion rifle, you can rely more on Aim Assist than Stability - Full Bore, Projection Fuse, and a Range Masterwork will push the range out to 58, which is 17m ADS-ed, at the cost of 10 Stability and 5 Handling - just make sure you've got Targeting mods on your helmet too. In the first trait column as your support park, Well Rounded is easy to proc using Strand abilities - 1 stack recovers the Full Bore penalties and takes the range to 65 (ADS 17.52m), and at 2 stacks, you'll have 78 range (ADS 18.05m), 40 Stability and 67 Handling. The Enhanced version is even better adding 12 to Range, Stability and Handling per stack - at 2 stacks you'll push out range to 18.24m, which is more than Cartesian! Demolitionist as your second column signature perk, completes the loop by generating 20% grenade ability energy on a kill (22% for the Enhanced perk). You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=202670084,2969185026,744594675,3523296417

// Extended Barrel, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a Stasis subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Extended Barrel, Projection Fuse, a Range Masterwork and a Counterbalance mod will push the Range out to 53, which is 16.73m ADS-ed, and improve Recoil Direction by 25, at the cost of 10 Handling. In the support perk, first trait column, slot Under Pressure (which should be procced constantly adds 30 Stability and accuracy, and then in the second for your signature perk, Elemental Capacitor used with Stasis, takes the Recoil Direction to a near-perfect 97, which should make for a very controllable FR. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often.Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

In the first trait column as your support perk, Under Pressure should be procced constantly which will add 30 stability to make the recoil easier to control and add accuracy to the bolts, and then as your second column signature perk, Adrenaline Junkie x5 from a grenade kill will drop the TTK to 0.7s with six bolts and any additional damage boost (such as solar Radiant) drops the all-resilience TTK to 0.63s with only five bolts. // Basso Ostinato (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Accurized Rounds, Well Rounded, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Rapid-fire shotguns have the lowest range of the shotgun archetype, so Basso Ostinato needs the right perks to compete. If you're lucky enough to drop one with Corkscrew or Smallbore and Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork, that gets you to 51 (5.27m range hipfire or ADS). But then if you add on Well Rounded as your first trait column support park, and proc both stacks, and then get Opening Shot as your second column signature perk as well, that pushes range out to 97 (6.59m) - aim for the neck and you should be good for a OHK in range, or a two-hit kill out to 8m or so. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=4090651448,3142289711,744594675,47981717
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1482024992,3142289711,744594675,47981717

// Basso Ostinato (PvP backup roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Accurized Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). Backup PvP pick for duelling. Rapid-fire shotguns have the lowest range of the shotgun archetype, so Basso Ostinato needs the right perks to compete. If you're lucky enough to drop one with Corkscrew or Smallbore and Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork, that gets you to 51 (5.27m range hipfire or ADS). Perpetual Motion as your first trait column support park, is pretty easy to proc both stacks for 20 to handling, stability and reload speed, and then get Opening Shot as your second column signature perk as well, that pushes range out to 76 (6.00m) - aim for the neck and you should be good for a OHK in range, or a two-hit kill out to 7.5m or so. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, M+KB, Controller

// Volta Bracket (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Alloy Mag, Fluted Barrel), Firmly Planted, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Average stats by comparison with other Aggressive sniper rifles and a tough-to-use 50 Zoom. But this can be very usable with the right perks. We can get range elsewhere, so you can use the barrel to boost handling with Fluted Barrel and a Handling Masterwork, and use the magazine to (unusually) boost reload speed as the most useful remaining stat - Alloy Mag is better with an empty mag or Flared Magwell if you still have one in the chamber. The combination of Enhanced Firmly Planted adding 35 Handling, 25 Stability, boosting recoil control, and improving accuracy and Enhanced Opening Shot as the second column signature perk layering on another 30 Range, 25 Aim Assist and more accuracy, brings you to totals of 100 Range, 53 Stability, 84 Handling and 68 Aim Assist. After landing two hits, the Nanotech Tracer Rocket origin trait should proc on the third shot (if you've picked up an ammo brick) - it won't make anyone body-shottable, but it's a bit of fun. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Volta Bracket (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Accurized Rounds, Firmly Planted, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). Backup PvP pick for kill-chaining with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Average stats by comparison with other Aggressive sniper rifles and a tough-to-use 50 Zoom. But this can be very usable with the right perks. Fluted Barrel is the traditional barrel choice to bump handling, and Accurized Rounds does the same to range. In the first trat column as the support perk, Enhanced Firmly Planted adds 35 Handling, 25 Stability, boosts recoil control, and improves accuracy to make follow up shots easier. Hatchling as the second column signature perk spawns a Threadling on a crit kill - any opponent damaged by it up to 9 resilience can be body shot - if you run Thread of Evolution you'll be able to body shot any resilience. After landing two hits, the Nanotech Tracer Rocket origin trait should proc on the third shot (if you've picked up an ammo brick) - it won't make anyone body-shottable on its own, but it's a bit of fun. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,3142289711,280464955,831391274

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid (PvP first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, (Shot Swap, Unrelenting), One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The first-ever Compressed Wave Frame power grenade launcher, so we have no real comparisons to make. Unfortunately it's not a great choice for PvP. To get a one-hit-kill you have to get a direct impact hit and the wave to strike too. If you do craft one for PvP, the blast radius stat has no real effect, so go all in to Velocity - Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds with a Velocity Masterwork push the stat to 63. There's thin pickings for your first trait column support perk - Shot Swap means at least means you have a fast stow speed after you're finished or, possibly, Unrelenting. Again, there's not much on offer in the second trait column for your signature perk - One For All when procced does mean that you can one-hit-kill with the wave alone, so maybe this is one to save for using on a control zone in 6s. You might occasionally see the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait proc, but that'll more be for fun than anything else. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2586829431,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3108830275,4049631843

// Circular Logic (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Extended Mag, Keep Away, Eye of the Storm
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. It's an adaptive frame LMG, so it's not the best choice for any Crucible activities. There's a base 0.53s TTK with 5 crits and 0 body shots and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.67s (2c, 4b). With that said, Smallbore adds a bit of extra range and stability, and then you want to get you mag as large as possible to pick up as many shots from a power ammo brick as you can. You're not going to be reloading, so Extended Mag and a Backup Mag are the way to go. For duelling, Keep Away in the first trait column as your support perk adds in some 10 range and accuracy when you're not in CQC. Eye of the Storm in the second as your signature perk layers on additional handling and accuracy while you're in a gunfight. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,3619207468,699525795

// Circular Logic (PvP first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for hip-fire kill-chaining. It's an adaptive frame LMG, so it's not the best choice for any Crucible activities. There's a base 0.53s TTK with 5 crits and 0 body shots and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.67s (2c, 4b). With that said, Smallbore adds a bit of extra range and stability, and then you want to get you mag as large as possible to pick up as many shots from a power ammo brick as you can. You're not going to be reloading, so Extended Mag and a Backup Mag are the way to go. If you're happy to hip-fire, for kill-chaining Offhand Strike as the first trait column support perk boosts range and accuracy after that first kill, while one stack of Golden Tricorn in the second column as your signature perk makes the TTK easier to get with 3 crits and 2 bodies, while two stacks reduces TTK to 0.4s (2c, 2b). Similarly, a Hatchling with Thread of Evolution on a Strand subclass will soften up an opponent for the same 0.4s TTK. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,2416023159,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,2416023159,831391274

// Rufus's Fury (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, (Target Lock, Frenzy)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Rufus's Fury (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), (Rewind Rounds, Demolitionist), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand synergy in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds or Demolitionist both work as support perks in the first trait column, pairing Hatchling for Strand synergy (which should be even better when the additional fragments arrive). The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=484515708&perks=839105230,1885400500,3418782618,831391274
dimwishlist:item=484515708&perks=839105230,3230963543,3418782618,831391274
dimwishlist:item=484515708&perks=839105230,1885400500,3523296417,831391274
dimwishlist:item=484515708&perks=839105230,3230963543,3523296417,831391274

// Rufus's Fury (PvE backup roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Rewind Rounds, Demolitionist), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Strand synergy in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. High-Caliber Rounds or Armor-Piercing Rounds add range and either flinch or overpenetration in the mag. Rewind Rounds or Demolitionist both work as support perks in the first trait column, pairing Hatchling for Strand synergy (which should be even better when the additional fragments arrive). The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Rufus's Fury (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, (Target Lock, Frenzy)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Rufus's Fury (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Darkness subclass synergy in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Paracausal Affinity as a signature perk for a 20% boost to damage following a kill from any Darkness damage source. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Mykel's Reverence (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range and/or Stability in the barrel and magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Frenzy as the second column signature perk to effectively extend the magazine and keep the 15% damage boost going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

dimwishlist:item=231031173&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3418782618,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=231031173&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3418782618,4104185692

Backup PvE roll for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range and/or Stability in the barrel and use the magazine to add a combat utility perk. // Mykel's Reverence (Adapt) (PvE backup roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Rewind Rounds, Paracasual Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Darkness subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range and/or Stability in the barrel and magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Paracausal Affinity for a 20% damage boost following a kill from any Darkness damage source. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

dimwishlist:item=1986287028&perks=3250034553,1561002382,3418782618,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=1986287028&perks=1482024992,1968497646,3418782618,3215448563

// Nessa's Oblation (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Assault Mag, (Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm), (Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Assault Mag increases RPM to 70 to increase your damage output. As your first trait column support perk, Reconstruction or Fourth Time's The Charm both work to extend the magazine during a damage window and, for your second column signature perk, take your choice of Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon or Focused Fury. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Nessa's Oblation (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Tactical Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades (remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills), which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1482024992,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=4090651448,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=839105230,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1840239774,106909392,3523296417,3215448563

// Nessa's Oblation (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Tactical Mag, FRepulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Void subclass synergy in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still be effective to control beefier minors, and majors. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. It's unusual to be able to roll two Void perks, so the opportunity to roll Repulsor Brace in the first trait column as your support perk, for damage reduction void overshields, and Destabilizing Rounds as your signature perk in the second to spread volatility on a kill is difficult to pass up. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Acasia's Dejection (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater), Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. You can use this as a pseudo primary weapon with Field Prep as your first trait column support perk boosting your reserves, and Frenzy as your second column signature perk not only boosting damage by 15%, but capping out Handling and Reload Speed at 100. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range or Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Acasia's Dejection (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater), (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Acasia's Dejection (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater), (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Solar subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against crowds of adds, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Incandescent's scorch and ignition solar-subclass verbs for crowd control as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Acasia's Dejection (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater), Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. You can use this as a pseudo primary weapon with Field Prep as your first trait column support perk boosting your reserves, and Frenzy as your second column signature perk not only boosting damage by 15%, but capping out Handling and Reload Speed at 100. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range or Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Acasia's Dejection (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater), (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Acasia's Dejection (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater), (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Koraxis's Distress (PvE first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius (let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion), or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius of Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=1441682018,3301904089,2396489472,831391274
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2396489472,831391274

// Koraxis's Distress (PvE first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, you'll want the Blast Radius as large as possible - Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordnance add 25 and a masterwork adds another 10. Then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=1478423395,1380253176,2396489472,831391274

// Koraxis's Distress (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Linear Compensator, Quick Launch), Spike Grenades, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius (let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion), or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius of Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
