//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, you'll want the Blast Radius as large as possible - Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordnance add 25 and a masterwork adds another 10. Then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=495442100&perks=1478423395,1380253176,2396489472,831391274

// Koraxis's Distress (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Linear Compensator, Quick Launch), Spike Grenades, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius (let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion), or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius of Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Briar's Contempt (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), Enhanced Battery, (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Focused Fury 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine to keep get as many shots with Focused Fury's damage boost as possible, as your second trait column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Briar's Contempt (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), Enhanced Battery, (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Demolitionist), Frenzy 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by up to 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine, or alternatively Demolitionist provides an instant reload to keep damage uptime for Frenzy's 15% damage boost as your second trait column signature perk. The additional 50 Reload Speed from Frenzy is handy, once you do need to reload, too. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Briar's Contempt (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), Enhanced Battery, Incandescent, Paracausal Affinity 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10% so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. Unusually, you can roll Incandescent in the first trait column as your support perk, to synergise with solar subclasses to improve scorch and ignition, and proc Paracausal Affinity in the second column as your signature park. Paracausal Affinity then buffs ignition damage to keep the loop going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

@title:Season 20 Trials of Osiris and Iron Banner Weapons
@description:Season of Defiance new and reprosed Trials and IB weapons

// The Immortal (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation but, for the sake of control on a controller, you'll probably want to add a little stability into the mix or, at the very least, not penalise it. With that in mind, Smallbore is the top pick for the barrel perk, although Hammer-Forged Rifling and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. The roll that everyone's hot for is Rangefinder as the first trait column support perk and Target Lock as the signature perk in the second. Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 20 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 50 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2846385770,365154968
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=3250034553,1885400500,2846385770,365154968
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=4090651448,1885400500,2846385770,365154968

// The Immortal (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation, and as stability isn't too much of a priority for M&KB, Full Bore is the best choice, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. The roll that everyone's hot for is Rangefinder as the first trait column support perk and Target Lock as the signature perk in the second. Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=202670084,1885400500,2846385770,365154968

// The Immortal (PvP backup roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reducation, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). Backup PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation. Full Bore gives you the most range at the cost of 10 Stability - but we've got a trait perk for that - and 5 Handling, with Ricochet Rounds also the clear standout in the magazine. Dynamic Sway Reduction as the first column support perk has a natural synergy with Target Lock to keep your reticule on target, adding stability and accuracy with every shot that lands, so balancing the barrel stability penalties. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=202670084,1885400500,1359896290,365154968

// The Immortal (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, (Rangefinder, Encore), Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation but, for the sake of control on a controller, you'll probably want to add a little stability into the mix or, at the very least, not penalise it. With that in mind, Smallbore is the top pick for the barrel perk, although Hammer-Forged Rifling and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. For a kill-chaining roll, Kill Clip as your second trait column signature perk reduces the TTK to 0.58s (7c, 1b) - even faster than Target Lock. Pairing with this, Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil, or Encore pairs well with extra range, stability and accuracy on kills. Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2846385770,1015611457

dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=4090651448,1885400500,2846385770,1015611457

dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=202670084,1885400500,1195158366,1015611457

// The Immortal (PvP first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation. Full Bore gives you the most range at the cost of 10 Stability - but we've got a trait perk for that - and 5 Handling, with Ricochet Rounds also the clear standout in the magazine. For a kill-chaining roll, Kill Clip as your second trait column signature perk reduces the TTK to 0.58s (7c, 1b) - even faster than Target Lock. As the support perk in the first column, Dynamic Sway Reduction keeps your reticule on target, adding stability and accuracy with every shot that lands, balancing out the barrel stability penalties. Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4039572196&perks=202670084,1885400500,1359896290,1015611457

// The Immortal (Adept) (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation but, for the sake of control on a controller, you'll probably want to add a little stability into the mix or, at the very least, not penalise it. With that in mind, Smallbore is the top pick for the barrel perk, although Hammer-Forged Rifling and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. The roll that everyone's hot for is Rangefinder as the first trait column support perk and Target Lock as the signature perk in the second. Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 20 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 50 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with an Adept Range mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3193598749&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2846385770,365154968
dimwishlist:item=3193598749&perks=3250034553,1885400500,2846385770,365154968
dimwishlist:item=3193598749&perks=4090651448,1885400500,2846385770,365154968

// The Immortal (Adept) (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation, and as stability isn't too much of a priority for M&KB, Full Bore is the best choice, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. The roll that everyone's hot for is Rangefinder as the first trait column support perk and Target Lock as the signature perk in the second. Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with an Adept Range mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3193598749&perks=202670084,1885400500,2846385770,365154968

// The Immortal (Adept) (PvP backup roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reducation, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). Backup PvP pick for duelling. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation. Full Bore gives you the most range at the cost of 10 Stability - but we've got a trait perk for that - and 5 Handling, with Ricochet Rounds also the clear standout in the magazine. Dynamic Sway Reduction as the first column support perk has a natural synergy with Target Lock to keep your reticule on target, adding stability and accuracy with every shot that lands, so balancing the barrel stability penalties. Target Lock reduces the TTK down to 0.67s at 10 resilience (8c, 1b), and will melt anyone running 4 resilience or less on 0.53s with 8 crits, at the cost of having to commit to the engagement for the perk to proc - so no peek shooting! Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with an Adept Range mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Immortal (Adept) (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, (Rangefinder, Encore), Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. The base stats and perks are pretty stellar - Immortal has the highest range, stability and aim assist of any aggressive SMG. The out-of-the-box TTK is 0.75s for any resilience with 8 crits and 2 bodies, and the Accuracy Adjusted TTK is 0.83s (5c, 6b). You can push the range out all the way to 100 AND add Rangefinder on top of that with the right combination of perks and situation but, for the sake of control on a controller, you'll probably want to add a little stability into the mix or, at the very least, not penalise it. With that in mind, Smallbore is the top pick for the barrel perk, although Hammer-Forged Rifling and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives, with Ricochet Rounds the clear standout in the magazine. For a kill-chaining roll, Kill Clip as your second trait column signature perk reduces the TTK to 0.58s (7c, 1b) - even faster than Target Lock. Pairing with this, Rangefinder's additional point of Zoom both pushes out your effective range and damage falloff, and constrains the recoil, or Encore pairs well with extra range, stability and accuracy on kills. Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: Range, with an Adept Range mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Astral Horizon (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smoothbore, Accurized Rounds, Slideshot, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Astral Horizon has decent stats by comparison with other kinetic slot aggressive shotguns, and an excellent PvP perk pool. Smoothbore, since S17 when the pellet spread was drastically reduced, is by far the best barrel perk for pushing out your range without any real downside. Add in Accurized Rounds as the magazine perk, Slideshot as your support perk in the first trait column, and Opening Shot as the signature perk in the second, and you'll be touching 94 range when everything's active. That'll push your damage drop-off out to 6.5m when hipfiring. Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: you could go Range to push to 100 for an extra 0.2m, but a better option is probably Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2653171213&perks=466087222,3142289711,3161816588,47981717

// Astral Horizon (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smoothbore, Accurized Rounds, Killing Wind, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Astral Horizon has decent stats by comparison with other kinetic slot aggressive shotguns, and an excellent PvP perk pool. Smoothbore, since S17 when the pellet spread was drastically reduced, is by far the best barrel perk for pushing out your range without any real downside. Add in Accurized Rounds as the magazine perk, Kill Chaining as your support perk in the first trait column, and Opening Shot as the signature perk in the second, and you'll be touching 94 range and 78 Handling after a kill. That'll push your damage drop-off out to 6.5m when hipfiring. Alacrity is the best of the origin perks - when active it adds 10 range, 10 Aim Assist, 20 Stability and 20 Reload Speed. Recommended MW: you could go Range to push to 100 for an extra 0.2m, but a better option is probably Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod. // Astral Horizon (Adept) (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smoothbore, Accurized Rounds, Killing Wind, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Astral Horizon has decent stats by comparison with other kinetic slot aggressive shotguns, and an excellent PvP perk pool. // Bite of the Fox (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Accurized Rounds, FLared Magwell), (Snapshot Sights, No Distractions), Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Bite of the Fox is still as good in Season 20 as when the original arrived in Season 4. Lowest (except for Revoker) Zoom of 43 so you have as good a view when ADSed as you're likely to get. Handling is the normal play for the barrel perk, and this is no different, so FLuted Barrel would be the barrel perk of choice. The magazine perk doesn't make a huge different - Accurized Rounds maxes the range and pushes aim assist out a bit - not that you should really need it, or Flared Magwell adds to reload speed if you pick up a brick. for your support perk in the first trait column, your preferred sniping style would dictate either Snapshot Sights for more aggressive play or No Distractions for holding down a lane. In the second trait column as your signature perk, Opening Shot is the standout choice, improving range and accuracy. The Skulking Wolf is an occasionally helpful trait to proc if you've taken damage before winning your duel. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your play style. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1403800851&perks=1840239774,3230963543,957782887,47981717
dimwishlist:item=1403800851&perks=1840239774,3177308360,957782887,47981717
dimwishlist:item=1403800851&perks=1840239774,3230963543,2866798147,47981717
dimwishlist:item=1403800851&perks=1840239774,3177308360,2866798147,47981717

// The Hero's Burden (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Accurized Rounds, Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reducaiton
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Adaptive SMGs are in a bit of a tough spot, with the same TTK as Lightweights but needing all crits to kill in 0.73s (12 crits, 0 body shots), a slower Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 0.86s (8c, 6b)  and no bonus to Mobility or movement speed. There's no Rangefinder either, to help with range so you'll have to use your barrel and mag perks to try and be competitive. Full Bore in the barrel gives you as much range as possible - we can recover the penalties to stability and handling, with trait and origin perks - together with Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork results in 21.35m ADSed range. If you're going to try and hit all headshots, you'll need as much help as possible - both Zen Moment and Dynamic Sway Reduction as your trait perks may seem like overkill but, it's probably the only way to stand a chance. The Suros origin trait is one of the best for PvP, adding 36 handling and 20% flinch resistance after a reload. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your play style. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1028124540&perks=202670084,3142289711,2387244414,1359896290

// The Wizened Rebuke (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Offhand Strike, Backup Plan
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. The revised Wizened Rebuke was always A-Tier, if you learned to pre-charge, but with Season 20, and the new perk pool, it's now solidly S-Tier. With only five bolts fired, so less recoil to control, you can go all into range on M&KB - Full Bore and Projectile Fuse being the barrel and battery choices. Offhand Strike as the support perk in the first trait column is unbelievably good as at v7.0.0.6 when hipfiring after a kill - the additional range, stability and accuracy procced mean you'll be mapping people out to 25m or so for 7s (so make sure to pick up a few special bricks first!). To get the ball rolling for kill-chaining, Backup Plan as your second trait column signature perk makes no difference to the number of bolts needed to kill, which remains at four, and drops the charge time down to that of an adaptive frame's when procced. Recommended MW: Range, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2290416&perks=202670084,2969185026,2416023159,1600092898

// The Wizened Rebuke (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Offhand Strike, Successful Warm-Up
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. The revised Wizened Rebuke was always A-Tier, if you learned to pre-charge, but with Season 20, and the new perk pool, it's now solidly S-Tier. With only five bolts fired, so less recoil to control, you can go all into range on M&KB - Full Bore and Projectile Fuse being the barrel and battery choices. Offhand Strike as the support perk in the first trait column is unbelievably good as at v7.0.0.6 when hipfiring after a kill - the additional range, stability and accuracy procced mean you'll be mapping people out to 25m or so for 7s (so make sure to pick up a few special bricks first!). Successful Warm-up also procs on a kill to reduce charge time to faster-than-adaptive levels for 6s to make for a monster of a kill-chaining roll. Recommended MW: Range, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2290416&perks=202670084,2969185026,2416023159,2652708987

With only five bolts fired, so less recoil to control, you can spec into range with Smallbore or Hammer-Forged Rifling and Projectile Fuse as barrel and battery choices. Offhand Strike as the support perk in the first trait column is unbelievably good as at v7.0.0.6 when hipfiring after a kill - the additional range, stability and accuracy procced mean you'll be mapping people out to 25m or so for 7s (so make sure to pick up a few special bricks first!). To get the ball rolling for kill-chaining, Backup Plan as your second trait column signature perk makes no difference to the number of bolts needed to kill, which remains at four, and drops the charge time down to that of an adaptive frame's when procced. dimwishlist:item=2290416&perks=3250034553,2969185026,2416023159,2652708987

// Jorum's Claw (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, Encore, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Jorum's Claw, like other adaptive pulse rifles, has an abysmal TTK of 0.93s out of the box, with 6 crits and 1 body shot, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 4b), but is very sensitive to even the smallest of damage buffs - Radiant, for example, drops the TTK down to 0.6s (6c). The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, with the low Zoom of 17 being useful for closer-range engagements at the cost of limiting the range and damage drop-off. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot tidies up the Recoil Direction, and adds a useful bump to Handling too, and Ricochet Rounds rounds out Range and Stability. For kill-chaining, Encore as the first trait column support perk provides more stability, handling and accuracy after a kill, to make hitting your crits easier, and Golden Tricorn as the second column signature perk drops the TTK to 0.6s (5c, 1b) at one stack. It's not impossible to proc the second stack, with this being a solar weapon, which drops the TTK further to 0.53s (3c, 2b). Titans can build even further into a kill-chaining roll with Path of Burning Steps, as the damage stacks with Golden Tricorn. Recommended MW: Range, Stability of Handling depending on preference, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillClip, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=62937067&perks=839105230,1885400500,1195158366,2610012052

// Jorum's Claw (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, Outlaw, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Jorum's Claw, like other adaptive pulse rifles, has an abysmal TTK of 0.93s out of the box, with 6 crits and 1 body shot, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 4b), but is very sensitive to even the smallest of damage buffs - Radiant, for example, drops the TTK down to 0.6s (6c). The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, with the low Zoom of 17 being useful for closer-range engagements at the cost of limiting the range and damage drop-off. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot tidies up the Recoil Direction, and adds a useful bump to Handling too, and Ricochet Rounds rounds out Range and Stability. For kill-chaining, the old and trusted combination of Outlaw and Kill Clip as support and signature perks in the first and second trait columns drops the TTK to 0.6s (4c, 2b) - Radiant or Burning Steps x1 procced at the same time drops it still further to 0.53s (4c, 1b) as the damage stacks. Recommended MW: Range, Stability of Handling depending on preference, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillCHain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=62937067&perks=839105230,1885400500,1168162263,1015611457


@title:Season of Defiance Devrim Kay VIII and Foundry weapons
@description:Season 20 new and reprised weapons with the Field Tested or Foundry origin trait

// Battle Scar (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds), Shoot to Loot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles (as at v7.0.0.7, anyway) but they add a very useful +20 mobility (useful when buildcrafting) and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers (five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!). You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. Battle Scar is one of the first kinetic weapons that can roll with Kinetic Tremors as your signature perk in the second trait column - for end-game activities this pairs nicely with Shoot to Loot as, as well as the passive damage boost just for repeated hits you will also pick up ammo from anywhere in the shockwave area and reload all of your guns too. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Battle Scar (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds), (Perpetual Motion, Keep Away), Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles (as at v7.0.0.7, anyway) but they add a very useful +20 mobility (useful when buildcrafting) and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers (five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!). You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. To improve your gunfeel, in the first trait slot as you r support perk, Perpetual Motion adds a decent bump to handling, stability and reload speed, or if you want extra range then Keep Away boosts that, reload speed and accuracy. Osmosis, as your signature perk in the second trait column is fairly rare and will pick up any of the energy synergies from your subclass (say, volatile rounds when that's procced by a void ability) - if you haven't already got a pulse rifle with the perk, then this would be worth hanging on to. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preferece, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Harsh Language (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, (Destabilizing Rounds, Repulsor Brace)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and Minor add clear in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper (although the range of stats is pretty compressed) - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. the standout support perk in the first trait column is Envious Assassin - you can get up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon. You have a choice of two signature perks in the second trait column to help with add clear - Destabilising Rounds is the more offensive option for add clear or Repulsor Brace for tanking damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,2048641572

// Harsh Language (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, (Envious Assassin, Field Prep, Threat Detector, Stats for All), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper (although the range of stats is pretty compressed) - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. In the first trait column Envious Assassin can give you up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon, but Field Prep, Threat Detector or Stats for All are all worth considering as a support perk. Void subclasses provide a great toolkit to trigger the second stack of Golden Tricorn for 50% bonus damage, in the second trait column for your signature perk. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Hand in Hand (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for sustained damage to Bosses and Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently (as at v7.0.0.6) in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Building towards One-Two Punch as your signature perk, Full Choke aids pellet spread, as you'll need to hit your target with all of them. Then Tactical Mag adds an extra extra shot (and a bonuses to reload speed and stability which admittedly, you'll not need so much). As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full for One-Two Punch in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Hand in Hand (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling), Assault Mag, Slideshot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently (as at v7.0.0.6) in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Handling is the standard play for shotguns, so Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling are your best choices. Assault Mag brings your RPM up to 60 and also boosts stability - maybe not so essential with a slower firing shottie, but still nice. As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full, and you can take advantage of the arc toolkit to proc the second stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column to boost damage by 50%, as well as proccing useful arc verbs, like Blinding with Spark of Beacons. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Nasreddin (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for damage to Bosses in end-game content. First thing to say about the reprised Nasreddin (named for a legendary trickster figure in Muslin folklore) is that if you already have a decent arc sword, you can give this a miss, as there's nothing that really makes it stand out except, maybe, for a slightly higher base Impact stat, and the new Devrim Kay VIII Foundry origin trait which should make the heavy attack rechage rate a little faster, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. For newer Guardians, the usual recommendations of Jagged Edge as the blade perk for additinal damage, Swordmaster's Guard for the guard perk to get the heavy attack up as fast as possible. Then Relentless Strikes as your support perk in the first trait column, which works well to return ammo against all enemies, and either Whirlwind Blade or Surrounded, to boost damage, for your signature perk in the second. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Senuna SI6 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Light Mag), Feeding Frenzy, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon (named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking) is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while Headstone as your signature perk in the second trait column generates your Stasis crystal on a crit kill to use your subclass fragments with. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1087426260,2779035018,124408337

dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,679225683,2779035018,124408337

First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon (named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking) is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while the first stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column is a reliable 15% damage boost, even if the second stack is tougher to proc with Stasis abilities. // Senuna SI6 (PvE first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon (named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking) is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, you can take your pick of any combat effect perk - High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds. Grave Robber as your support perk in the first trait column bypasses reloads just for melee kills on adds and, if that's what you're doing, Pugilist synergises well as your signature perk in the second trait column, by returning melee energy on kills. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Irukandji (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling), (Steady Rounds, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Envious Assassing, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit), (Firing Line, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in a fireteam in end-game content. The Season 20 Veist weapon is a rapid-fire sniper rifle with as-expected lowish stats, as a World drop weapon. Irukandji (a small, rare, highly venomous jellyfish from Australia, because of course it would be) does benefit from the Veist Stinger origin trait which is occasionally useful even in its nerfed state. Remember that as at Season 20, this will do less base damage than an equivalent kinetic weapon so, to be competitive, you'll need the parks to fall your way. The main issue you'll find is with keeping the reticule on a boss's crit spot - you'll need to boost Recoil Direction and Stability to make this easier, so Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling are your barrel perk choices, and Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Steady Rounds (you're not likely to be outside of the damage falloff distance, even with the range penalty) should be your mag perk options. As your first trait column support perk, Envious Assassin overflows your magazine passively with primary and power weapon kills, Fourth Time's The Charm works extends the magazine if you hit crits consistently, or Rapid Hit improves stability (and reload speed) as you fire to keep your reticule steadier. In the signature perk, second column trait, Firing Line is more forgiving of an occasional missed shot when you're in a fireteam but, if you're flying solo, Focused Fury will boost damage in the bottom half of your magazine if you can hit your crits consistently. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Marsilion-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Augmented Drum, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control. With 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will be much less effective, so Augmented Drum is the better mag perk, as this synergises with Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column, for more ammo reserves and faster reloads. The Enhanced Explosive Light perk grants an extra stack of damage over the standard version, so you'll have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3525010810,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3798852852,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027

// Marsilion-C (PvE first-choice roll)

First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control and, even with 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will still provide some extra impact damage as your mag perk. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon skills so you can take full advantage of the Enhanced Explosive Light's extra stack of damage over the standard version and have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! // Marsilion-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Volatile Launch, Confined Launch), High-Explosive Ordnance, (Envious Assassin, Field Prep), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. If you looking for a fun add-clear weapon for bulkier minors, with an eye towards Incandescent as your signature perk in the second trait slot, then maximise your Blast Radius with your barrel and mag perks, and masterwork - Volatile Launch or Confined Launch with High-Explosive Ordnance. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon kills, or Field Prep adds bonus reserves and reload speed as you options for your support park in the first trait column. Both add utility to Incandescent, and you can add Ember of Ashes for more scorch stacks and faster ignitions. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=1478423395,1380253176,968510818,4293542123

// Coronach-22 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Feeding Frenzy, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. If you didn't pick up an Ammit with Incandescent from Witch Queen, this gives you access to a similar (if unenhanced) set of perks. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk takes Recoil Direction to 100 and adds Handling for snappiness. To fill in the other gunfeel stats, Flared Magwell boosts Stability and Reload Speed, or Light Mag boosts Range and Reload Speed in the mag. As the support perk, in the first trait column, Feeding Frenzy boosts reload speed further after kills - your solar ignition kills from Incandescent will add to the stacks, particularly when paired with Ember of Ashes. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=355382946&perks=839105230,3230963543,2779035018,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=355382946&perks=839105230,679225683,2779035018,4293542123

// Coronach-22 (PvE backup roll)
// Chambered Compensator, (Light Mag, Flared Magwell), Feeding Frenzy, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. (??? ???): Backup PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. If you didn't pick up an Ammit with Incandescent from Witch Queen, this gives you access to a similar (if unenhanced) set of perks. Chambered Compensator takes the Recoil Direction to a controllable 83, and adds stability at the cost of Handling. To further fill in the other gunfeel stats, Light Mag boosts Range and Reload Speed or Flared Magwell boosts Stability and Reload Speed in the mag. As the support perk, in the first trait column, Feeding Frenzy boosts reload speed further after kills - your solar ignition kills from Incandescent will add to the stacks, particularly when paired with Ember of Ashes. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

(??? ???): Backup PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. // Coronach-22 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Alloy Mag, Zen Moment, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for beefier Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk takes Recoil Direction to 100 and adds Handling for snappiness. This is one of the first ARs with Target Lock, so if you choose that as your second trait column signature perk to build towards, Alloy Mag makes a lot of sense as the magazine perk - you need to be firing continuously until the mag is empty to build damage stacks. Although generally more of a PvP perk, Zen Moment as the support perk helps with the lowish stability to keep shots on target for Target Lock's stacking damage boost. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=355382946&perks=839105230,1431678320,2387244414,365154968

// Perpetualis (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Extended Barrel, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Keep Away, Zen Moment), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling (and boost reload speed too). Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, Golden Tricorn is unique (as at v7.0.0.6, anyway) on a Strand auto rifle and the second stack isn't too difficult to proc by either using a grapple melee or shooting a Tangle, for a massive 50% damage boost for 10s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=1467527085,106909392,3619207468,2610012052

dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=1467527085,106909392,2387244414,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=1482024992,106909392,2387244414,261001205

// (Extended Barrel, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Keep Away, Zen Moment), Threadling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Strand synergy in general activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling (and reload speed too). Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, you have Hatchling to work with Threadling-boosting fragments. // Raconteur (PvE first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. Shapeable. Our first Stasis Precision Bow, with competitive stats by comparison with the other kinetic slot options, although Accuracy is the lowest of all the Precisions. Your aim with the Bowstring and Arrow, as ever, is to reduce the draw time, while not harming your accuracy or handling. Elastic String is the best for as low a draw time as possible and helps Handling too, at the cost of Accuracy, which you can recover with an Accuracy Masterwork, while Compact Arrow Shaft boosts handling and reload speed. Don't forget, the Noble Deeds origin perk will also boost both as well. If you ever see Archer's Tempo as the support perk in the first trait column then you don't need to look much further. Similarly, Explosive Head adds damage (and flinch) for free so is the best signature perk in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Accuracy or Draw Time, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,16392701,201365942,3365897133

// Raconteur (PvE first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Stasis synergy in general activities. Shapeable. Our first Stasis Precision Bow, with competitive stats by comparison with the other kinetic slot options, although Accuracy is the lowest of all the Precisions. Your aim with the Bowstring and Arrow, as ever, is to reduce the draw time, while not harming your accuracy or handling. Elastic String is the best for as low a draw time as possible and helps Handling too, at the cost of Accuracy, which you can recover with an Accuracy Masterwork, while Compact Arrow Shaft boosts handling and reload speed. Don't forget, the Noble Deeds origin perk will also boost both as well. If you ever see Archer's Tempo as the support perk in the first trait column then you don't need to look much further. To pair with your Stasis aspects and fragments, Headstone is your choice for signature perk in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Accuracy or Draw Time, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Royal Executioner (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option to control the bolts, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is the stand out support perk in the first trait column - overflow the magazine with primary and power weapon kills, and this is the only non-Raid fusion rifle that you can do that with. Every overflowed shot will then do 25% bonus damage with Reservoir Burst as your second trait column, signature perk, as well as making enemies explode, making this great for both add-clearing groups of minors and burst damage against majors. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,968510818,4293542123

// Royal Executioner (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, (Envious Assassin, Threat Detector, Lead from Gold), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Solar synergy in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is a stand out support perk in the first trait column, overflowing the magazine as you get primary and power weapon kills, but Threat Detector and Lead From Gold are right up there too. This is the first solar FR to give the option of Incandescent as the signature perk in the second column, which plays into the subclass verbs for end-game add clear. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
