// Prodigal Return (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Disorienting Grenades, Envious Assassin, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add suppression in end-game activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. For add control, Disorienting Grenades give you breathing space in a firefight. Pair that with Envious Assassin, which can give you up to three in the barrel(!) as your support perk in the first trait column, and Disruption Break, for 50% bonus kinetic damage to burst down chunkier red bar Minors and the occasional Major while they stumble around as the signature perk, and you probably have the perfect add control breach-loading GL. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling (for faster swaps) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,3032599245,968510818,1683379515
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=1441682018,3032599245,968510818,1683379515

// Prodigal Return (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, (Threadt Detector, Field Prep), Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Arc Synergy in general activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. With one eye towards building a weapon around Voltshot (this is the first GL with Voltshot as an option, although the jury is still out on whether that's a good idea or not) as the signature perk in the second trait column, we'll need to make the reload as fast as possible. High Velocity Rounds boosts reload speed as well as velocity. Then Threat Detector or Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column helps too. Using Spark of Beacons gives you arc Blinding on a kill, which should make the follow-up shot after a kill, to get your Jolt damage tick, easier to hit. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2869569095,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2869569095,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,2822142346,4071163871,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=1441682018,2822142346,4071163871,2173046394

// Regnant (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your pick of the support perks, Auto-Loading Holster lets you empty the magazine and reload while you're swapped to your DPS special weapon to rinse and repeat, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=3798852852,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027

// Regnant (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst DPS against majors in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your support perk, Envious Assassin overflows the magazine or the most quick shots to finish off a major or stunned Champion quickly, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=3525010810,3301904089,968510818,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=3798852852,3301904089,968510818,3194351027

// Regnant (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Explosive Ordnance, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. You'll be using this roll for add clearing, so you'll want to crank up the blast radius with your barrel with Volatile Launch, High Explosive Ordnance in the magazine, and a Blast Radious Masterwork. Repulsor Brace as your support perk in the first trait column gives you a void overshield for void-debuffed kills, which is exactly what Destabilizing Rounds sets you up for, as your signature perk in the second trait column, making targets near a kill volatile, including chunkier ones for easier clean-up with the next shot. This combination should make you a bit of a walking tank in add-dense areas, as long as you have ammo. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=1478423395,1380253176,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=1441682018,1380253176,776531651,2048641572

// Caretaker (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and minor add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 (except DSC's Bequest), and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support perk in the first trait column, both Tireless Blade and Relentless Strikes work but, once you get Incandescent working (and Ember of Ashes helps) as your signature perk in the second trait column, the ignite kills among adds count towards Tireless Blade kills, so that will be the more efficient way to regain ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,2590710093,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,4293542123

// Caretaker (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Relentless Strikes, Flash Counter), (Surrounded, One For All)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 (except DSC's Bequest), and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support park in the first trait column, Relentless Strikes don't require a kill to return ammo, so is best for chunkier adds and Majors, although Flash Counter's weaken effect is also worth considering. Majors are usually accompanied by minors, so Surrounded (especially when enhanced) or One for All as signature perks in the second trait column can both work well when you need to do damage up close. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,2590710093,4293542123

Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. // Round Robin (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber ROunds, Ricochet Rounds), (Stay Away, Subsistence), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for Strand synergy in general content. Shapeable. Our first Strand Hand Cannon. Middling stats by comparison with other Aggressive Frames - prioritise handling and stability with your barrel and mag to improve gunfeel. You should be engaging enemies at a decent range so Keep Away boosts range, accuracy and reload speed, or Subsistence will keep your mag topped up. In the second trait column Hatchling spawns a Threadling on crit kills to play with, and lets you tap into Strand fragments, and the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Synchronic Roulette (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Envious Assassin, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for Strand synergy in general content. Precision frame SMG, so you don't have to worry about recoil direction and range is pretty compressed, so go for handling and stability with your barrel. In the mag, High-Caliber Rounds is always good for extra flinch on a bullet hose, but Armor-Piercing is also decent for damaging multiple adds in CQC, Ricochet Rounds can be run or just get extra stability and Reload speed with Flared Magwell. There's not much PvE-wise in the first trait column - Envious Assassin is much better on a Special or Power weapon, but it's worth it for the occasional overfilled mag. In the second trait column Hatchling spawns a Threadling on rapid kills to play with, and lets you tap into Strand fragments, and the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion), Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - maybe not the play for end-game activities where you're probably in trouble if you're close enough to use it, but useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Destabilizing Rounds spreads volatility to surrounding adds on a kill to synergise with Void subclass verbs. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion), Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Trench Barrel is reliable for fast burst damage in CQC and works well on a rapid-fire frame. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Grave Robber, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for burst damage for Lethal Current/Liar's Handshake Hunters. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. You should be getting melee kills as you're rolling around and punching so Grave Robber should keep your mag filled, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage (even if it's been nerfed somewhat). On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, (Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion), One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage (even if it's been nerfed somewhat) to burst down a major, or even a boss. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1047830412,106909392,1556840489,2679249093
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1047830412,106909392,968510818,2679249093
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1047830412,106909392,1428297954,2679249093

// Iterative Loop (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils), Compulsive Reloader, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for Arc synergy and burst damage. Seeing as fusion rifles apply the highest Jolt tick damage of any special weapon, it would be rude not to pick or shape a roll. Rapid fire fusions need a fair bit of control with nine bolts being fired, so Arrowhead Break takes the recoil direction to 77, or up the stability through Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. In the battery, there's nothing to help speed up reloading, so Particle Repeater adds more stability, or Accelerated Coils speeds up charge time. Compulsive Reloader and a Reload Speed Masterwork boosts reload to 100 at the top half of the mag, so your reloads after a kill to proc Voltshot should be as snappy as it's possible to get. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with rapid kills - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. The first Compressed Wave Frame power-slot grenade launcher, so there's not really anything to compare against for the stats (so we can say with absolute certainty that the stats are best in class, average and worst in class all at the same time). Blast Radius only affects the initial impact, not the width of the wave so use the barrel to boost velocity and handling. Out of the two options for the mag, High Velocity Rounds is always the better one, improving Reload Speed too. There's an abundance of options for PvE in the first trait column, but the best option is Envious Assassin, passively overflowing the magazine as you get primary and special weapon kills, and then in the second, as this is primarily for add clear, Chain Reaction turns every kill into a stasis explosion, extending the damage radius and adding chunk damage against beefier enemies nearby. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Circular Logic (PvE backup roll)
// Chambered Compensator, (Extended Mag, Appended Mag), Envious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. The first Strand flavoured LMG as at v7.0.0.3 but unfortunately stats are low by comparison with other adaptive frames - but there's still a choice of very usable rolls. Chambered Compensator takes the recoil direction to a controllable 90 and adds some extra stability. For sustained damage in boss DPS phases, you're looking for a combination of Extended or Appended Mag, together with Envious Assassin to then overfill the magazine with primary and special weapon kills as you lead up to the damage phase, and Target Lock to rack up to 40% additional damage against a single target. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Stability/Handling, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Circular Logic (PvE first-choice roll)
// Chambered Compensator, (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds), (Feeding Frenzy, Keep Away, Pulse Monitor, Envious Assassin), (Hatchling, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. The first Strand flavoured LMG as at v7.0.0.3 but unfortunately stats are low by comparison with other adaptive frames - but there's still a choice of very usable rolls. Chambered Compensator takes the recoil direction to a controllable 90 and adds some extra stability. If you're using this for add clear, any one of the combat effect rounds (High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds) will work in the mag, then a reload park like Feeding Frenzy, maybe Keep Away if you're not up to your neck in CQC adds, Pulse Monitor to refill the magazine when your shield's broken, or Envious Assassin to overfill the magazine before you start, should work nicely. In the second trait column, Hatchling should add additional damage through Threadline creation, or the first stack of Golden Tricorn will be a reliable 15% damage boost - you might have a little more work to do getting Strand ability kills but when you do, 50% bonus damage for 10s should rip through even the beefiest minors and occasional major. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Stability/Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Seventh Seraph Officer Revolver (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, (Seraph Rounds, Extended Mag), Air Assault, Perfect Float
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Precision Hand Cannons have an uncompetitive, but easy 1.0 TTK with 2 crits and 2 bodies against any resilience - but they really need their stats and perks to line up to be competitive as at v7.0.0.3. Unfortunately, the stats for the Officer Revolver aren't great - really the only thing it has that's different is the Rasputin's Arsenal origin perk which refunds 50% of your magazine when you break a shield, and the option to use Seraph Rounds. Start off with Smallbore to push out range and stability, and then build into an what makes this unique - Seraph Rounds for all of the benefits of High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing and Ricochet Rounds or maximise your Airborne Effectiveness with Extended Mag, and let the origin trait keep your mag topped up. To keep doubling down into an aerial playstyle, Air Assault, Perfect Float and an Icarus Grip mod mean you can hit 83 AE, which should give you enough of an edge in the air. Recommended MW: Range, with an Icarus Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1555959830&perks=1482024992,1140096971,3722653512,2272927194
dimwishlist:item=1555959830&perks=1482024992,2420895100,3722653512,2272927194

// Seventh Seraph Carbine (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Seraph Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Precision auto rifles have a reasonable 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and a body, and a 0.93s Accuracy Adjusted TTK (4c, 4b) against any resilience. The stats aren't great - dragging along the bottom of its peers but even so it feels okay to use. Add in a little range and stability with Smallbore, and Seraph Rounds in the mag for all of the benefits of High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing and Ricochet Rounds. Dynamic Sway Reduction overcomes much of the gunfeel shortcomings and, in the last column Target Lock can reduce the TTK down to 0.67s up to 9 resilience, and with the Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait refunding 50% of your magazine on a shield break, you should be able to move between encounters after a kill with a nicely topped-up magazine. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. Backup PvP pick for duelling. Precision auto rifles have a reasonable 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and a body, and a 0.93s Accuracy Adjusted TTK (4c, 4b) against any resilience. The stats aren't great - dragging along the bottom of its peers but even so it feels okay to use. The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait can be really useful refunding 50% of your magazine on a shield break, so you should be able to move between encounters after a kill with a nicely topped-up magazine. // Seventh Seraph Carbine (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Seraph Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Precision auto rifles have a reasonable 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and a body, and a 0.93s Accuracy Adjusted TTK (4c, 4b) against any resilience. The stats aren't great - dragging along the bottom of its peers but even so it feels okay to use. Add in a little range and stability with Smallbore, and Seraph Rounds in the mag for all of the benefits of High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing and Ricochet Rounds. Dynamic Sway Reduction overcomes much of the gunfeel shortcomings and, in the last column Swashbuckler x1 makes the TTK easier to hit with 5 crits and 2 bodies, while a full x5 stack after a melee kill drops the TTK to 0.53s (5c), and AATTK to 0.67s (3c, 3b). The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait can be really useful, refunding 50% of your magazine on a shield break, so you should be able to move between encounters after a kill with a nicely topped-up magazine. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Terminus Horizon (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Extended Mag, (Rapid Hit, Demolitionist), (High-Impact Reserves, Wellspring)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. High Impact LMGs will kill any resilience in 0.67s with and easy 3 crits and 2 body shots - unfortunately, that's the same TTK as some competitive primaries and slower than most special weapons, so LMGs are in a tough place in PvP. If you do run one, you need to maximise the mag size to make sure you're getting as many shots as possible from a power ammo pickup - at base you'll get  21 shots, 24 with either Extended Mag or a Backup Mag mod, and 29 with both. Smallbore pushes out your range and stability - this fires fairly slowly so you should be able to control the recoil direction. In your first trait column, Rapid Hit's stability boost can help with hitting your crits, or Demolitionist harvests grenade energy on kills while, with your always being at the bottom of the magazine, High-Impact Reserves will always be procced, and can drop the TTK to 0.5s (4c), or Wellspring gets you even more ability energy. The intrinsic frame bonus of increased accuracy while ADsed and the Tex Balanced Stock Origin Trait of increased handling and movement speed while hipfiring either work against each other or give you the best of both worlds, depending on your perspective. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=487205709&perks=1482024992,2420895100,247725512,2213355989
dimwishlist:item=487205709&perks=1482024992,2420895100,3523296417,2213355989
dimwishlist:item=487205709&perks=1482024992,2420895100,247725512,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=487205709&perks=1482024992,2420895100,3523296417,3592538738

// Long Arm (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, (Under Pressure, Rapid Hit), High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The legendary Dead Man's Tale is an all new scout rifle aggressive archetype, with stats that fall somewhere between precision and high impacts and a less than competitive, if easy to hit TTK of 1.0s with 2 crits and 1 body shot. You can push out your range with your barrel and mag, as this is slow firing so you should hopefully be able to control the recoil, particularly if you add a Counterbalance mod. If you're able to resist reloading, Under Pressure or alternatively Rapid Hit add gunfeel boosts, and High-Impact Reserves can make the TTK easier to hit (1c, 2b up to 6 resilience) towards the bottom of the magazine. As a bonus, the Tex Balanced Stock Origin Trait of increased handling and movement speed while hipfiring won't take you all the way to DMT but will give you a slightly easier time if you want to try. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The legendary Dead Man's Tale is an all new scout rifle aggressive archetype, with stats that fall somewhere between precision and high impacts and a less than competitive, if easy to hit TTK of 1.0s with 2 crits and 1 body shot. You don't really need any more range with a scout rifle, so you can invest into other gunfeel stats with your barrel and mag. Rapid Hit layers on stability and reload speed, and the combination of Explosive Payload and 100 impact should result in real flinch problems for opponents while you keep hitting your crits. As a bonus, the Tex Balanced Stock Origin Trait of increased handling and movement speed while hipfiring won't take you all the way to DMT but will give you a slightly easier time if you want to try. // Wilderflight (PvP first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, Blinding Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. A new Breech-loading grenade launcher doublefire archetype so there's not really any comparisons to be made. This can kill in one shot, if both projectiles hit, but that's unlikely so instead take advantage of the larger blast radius offered by two separate explosions instead, and spread the disorientating (formerly blinding) grenades over a wider area. Auto-Loading Holster will mean that as long as you have ammo available, you'll always be able to take a shot and Disruption Break applies a debuff that makes opponents to take 50% more damage from kinetic weapons for an easy blinting clean-up. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Wilderflight (PvP first-choice roll)
// Linear Compensator, Proximity Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. A new Breech-loading grenade launcher doublefire archetype so there's not really any comparisons to be made. This can kill in one shot, if both projectiles hit, but that's unlikely so instead take advantage of the larger blast radius offered by two separate explosions instead. Look for a combination of handling, velocity and blast radius with your barrel, and Proximity Grenades give you a little leniency with your aim or remote detonation for a decent chunk of chip damage. Auto-Loading Holster will mean that as long as you have ammo available, you'll always be able to take a shot and Disruption Break applies a debuff that makes opponents to take 50% more damage from kinetic weapons for an easy blinting clean-up. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Liminal Vigil (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Tap the Trigger, Rangefinder
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Aggressive Burst sidearms have a TTK of 0.73s with 4 crits and 1 body shot and a still competitive accuracy adjusted TTK of 0.83s (1c, 5b). The ranges on all sidearms are compressed, and the recoil direction is already pretty much vertical, so use the barrel and mag to boost handling and stability. For duelling, Tap the Trigger will improve accuracy and stability on every trigger pull. Rangefinder is the only way of really boosting the range, adding 1.5m when ADSed, giving you a little more breathing room. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3138208275&perks=1840239774,1885400500,1890422124,2846385770

Aggressive Burst sidearms have a TTK of 0.73s with 4 crits and 1 body shot and a still competitive accuracy adjusted TTK of 0.83s (1c, 5b). The ranges on all sidearms are compressed, and the recoil direction is already pretty much vertical, so use the barrel and mag to boost handling and stability. For stasis synergy, Headstone provides crystals to use for benefits provided by fragments for Stasis subclasses and, in the second trait column, Rangefinder is the only way of really boosting the range, adding 1.5m when ADSed, giving you a little more breathing room. // Liminal Vigil (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Tunnel Vision, (Desperado, Kill Clip)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Aggressive Burst sidearms have a TTK of 0.73s with 4 crits and 1 body shot and a still competitive accuracy adjusted TTK of 0.83s (1c, 5b). The ranges on all sidearms are compressed, and the recoil direction is already pretty much vertical, so use the barrel and mag to boost handling and stability. For kill-chaining - so primarily for 6s PvP modes - Desperado reduces TTK to 0.57s for 6s after a crit kill or Kill Clip reduces to 0.47s (2c, 2b) for 5s after any kill. As you'll need to reload for the damage boost, Tunnel Vision is the obvious partner, to boost both accuracy and aim assist at the same time. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Liminal Vigil (PvP first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Aggressive Burst sidearms have a TTK of 0.73s with 4 crits and 1 body shot and a still competitive accuracy adjusted TTK of 0.83s (1c, 5b). The ranges on all sidearms are compressed, and the recoil direction is already pretty much vertical, so use the barrel and mag to boost handling and stability. For kill-chaining - so primarily for 6s PvP modes - both Surrounded and Swashbuckler x5 reduce TTK to 0.47s (2c, 2b), and as you're likely to be up close, Threat Detector adds stability and reload speed to keep your streak going. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Aurvandil FR6 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery), Reconstruction, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. Reconstruction then doubles your mag size, and bypasses any reload penalty and means that the top 3/4 of your magazine will now proc Chill Clip. The oversized magazine means you should also benefit from the Omolon origin perk stability boost. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. // Aurvandil FR6 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery), Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. If you spray with your first shot, then the SOFA (Stats/One For All) roll will more than offset any reload penalty, along with other gunfeel boosts, as well as increasing damage by a chunky 35%. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a touch of extra stability too. // Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Repulsor Brace
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee to add a void verb to your target to proc Repulsor Brace on a kill and generate a void overshield to help tank damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in endgame content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee for Golden Tricorn - you get a solid 15% extra damage for one stack after a kill or a hefty 50% bonus with an ability kill while the first stack is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Pugilist and Swashbuckler form a natural pairing - get your melee kill to proc 33% bonus damage, and then recover your melee energy with the easy kills that result. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Jararaca-3sr (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis subclasses in end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. You'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help reloads, so you can live without a reload speed-boosting magazine perk, especially with Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion in the first trait column. Finally, for Stasis synergy, in the second trait column Headstone's crystals work with your aspects and fragments. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1561002382,247725512,124408337
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1885400500,247725512,124408337
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1968497646,247725512,124408337
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1561002382,1428297954,124408337
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1885400500,1428297954,124408337
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1968497646,1428297954,124408337

// Jararaca-3sr (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Fourth Time's the Charm, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. You'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help with reloads. A combination of Fourth Time's the Charm to extend the mag together with Focused Fury, to add 20% bonus damage for hitting nine crits (assuming a mag size of 17) until you reload again should serve you well in end-game activities. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1561002382,1354429876,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1885400500,1354429876,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=1851521408&perks=839105230,1968497646,1354429876,2896038713

// Lodbrok-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, (Extended Mag, Appended Mag), Fourth Time's The Charm, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. To take full advantage of Target Lock, to burst down beefier minors, look for as large a magazine as you can and combine with Fourth Time's the Charm. This could be a little niche, but this roll with Lodbrok could be a useful tool to have in your loadout if you're facing constructs and vehicles, with the Hakke Breach Armaments' 15% damage boost on top of Target Lock. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=1482024992,2420895100,1354429876,365154968
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=1482024992,1087426260,1354429876,365154968

// Lodbrok-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Osmosis, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. Any of the combat effect magazines can help you - High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds - so that's down to your preference. Even though match game is less of an issue from Season 20, you can take advantage of any ability verbs from the grenade you throw - so, for example, a void grenade can proc Volatile Rounds which your now void energy Lodbrok will apply. Unfortunately Demolitionist rolls in the same trait column, but Adrenaline Junkie will trigger on a grenade kill for 33% boost to damage on top in the second column instead. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=1482024992,1561002382,1774574192,11612903
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=1482024992,1968497646,1774574192,11612903
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=1482024992,1885400500,1774574192,11612903

// Lodbrok-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. Any of the combat effect magazines can help you - High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds - so that's down to your preference. Demolitionist with Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing - get the grenade kill to proc 33% extra damage and then clean up to regenerate your grenade energy to keep the loop going. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

@title:Season of the Seraph World Drop Weapons
@description:Season of the Seraph (Season 19) world drop weapons

// Lodbrok-C (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Cascade Point
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Hakke Breach Armaments origin trait's +30% damage to constructs can be very useful with Titan barricades around. High Impact Auto Rifles have an out of the box TTK of 0.83s (6 crits 0 bodies) and accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 3b) as at v6.3.0.7. Decent stats across the board by comparison with its competitors. Arrowhead Brake tidies up the recoil direction and adds extra Handling, While Ricochet Rounds adds range and stability. Then, if you use Dynamic Sway Reduction to help with hitting your crits (or get a kill with another weapon), Cascade Point's increased fire rate reduces the TTK to 0.5s (6c) for 2.5s. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2328531378&perks=839105230,1885400500,1359896290,3751912585

Hakke Breach Armaments origin trait's +30% damage to constructs can be very useful with Titan barricades around. High Impact Auto Rifles have an out of the box TTK of 0.83s (6 crits 0 bodies) and accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 3b) as at v6.3.0.7. Decent stats across the board by comparison with its competitors. You can got for a little extra Range, Handling or Stability in the barrel and mag. Then, if you use Dynamic Sway Reduction to help with hitting your crits (or get a kill with another weapon), Cascade Point's increased fire rate reduces the TTK to 0.5s (6c) for 2.5s. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Counterbalance mod if you need to control the recoil, or alternatively a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. // Lodbrok-C (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Perpetual Motion, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Hakke Breach Armaments origin trait's +30% damage to constructs can be very useful with Titan barricades around. High Impact Auto Rifles have an out of the box TTK of 0.83s (6 crits 0 bodies) and accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 3b) as at v6.3.0.7. Decent stats across the board by comparison with its competitors. You can got for a little extra Range, Handling or Stability in the barrel. Kill Clip reduces the TTK to 0.67s (4c, 1b) and AATTK to 0.83s (3c, 3b), but you'll need your reload as snappy as possible to take advantage - Flared Magwell and Perpetual Motion are the best perks to help out. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Prolonged Engagement (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Extended Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling0, High-Caliber Rifling, Dynamic Sway Reducation, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. As a Season 19 Vanguard weapon, you need to have as many resets as possible to stand a reasonable chance of a decent roll. The Veist Stinger Origin Trait can be useful in combat to keep the mag topped up passively. Lightweight SMGs have a base TTK of 0.73s (10 crits, 2 bodies) and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.8s (9c, 4b), as well of the boost to mobility. With a zoom of only 14, and an in-band set of stats, you'll never compete for range, so you might as well capitalise on what makes this SMG different. Increase your range, recoil direction and/or handling with your barrel park, and capitalise on the 900 RPM with High-Caliber Rounds to add flinch. Dynamic Sway Reduction adds stability and accuracy boosts to keep your reticule on target, and Target Lock can drop the TTK by shaving off a bullet. Recommended MW: Range, with a Targeting Adjuster, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip or mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2349907931&perks=1467527085,1561002382,1359896290,365154968

dimwishlist:item=2349907931&perks=4090651448,1561002382,1359896290,365154968
dimwishlist:item=2349907931&perks=1840239774,1561002382,1359896290,365154968

// Prolonged Engagement (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Extended Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling0, High-Caliber Rifling, Offhand Strike, Multikill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. As a Season 19 Vanguard weapon, you need to have as many resets as possible to stand a reasonable chance of a decent roll. The Veist Stinger Origin Trait can be useful in combat to keep the mag topped up passively. Lightweight SMGs have a base TTK of 0.73s (10 crits, 2 bodies) and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.8s (9c, 4b), as well of the boost to mobility. With a zoom of only 14, and an in-band set of stats, you'll never compete for range, so you might as well capitalise on what makes this SMG different. Increase your range, recoil direction and/or handling with your barrel park, and capitalise on the 900 RPM with High-Caliber Rounds to add flinch. Lean into the hipfire lifestyle with Offhand Strike, to add stability and huge accuracy buffs, and a Freehand Grip mod, and combine that with Multikill Clip which, with one stack drops your TTK down to 0.6s (9c 1b) and AATTK to 0.73 (6c, 6b). Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Range, with a Freehand Grip mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Fioritura-59 (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, (Zen Moment, Killing Wind), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Suros Synergy is one of the most useful PvP perks, boosting handling and reducing flinch after a reload. Rapid-fire sidearms have a competitive out-of-the-box TTK of 0.6s (6c, 1b) and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.8s (3c, 4b) within their range. In-band stats, but with a standout Airborne Effectiveness of 23. Sidearm ranges are highly compressed, so boost stability with your barrel and mag instead to make crits easier. In the first trait column, Zen Moment can help keep your reticule on target or Killing Wind adds handling and mobility after a kill. In the second column, Kill Clip is tempting - reducing TTK to 0.53s (4c, 1b) for 5s when reloading after a kill, but Golden Tricorn x1 is the same TTK (albeit with 5c), and is easier to proc, as it doesn't need a reload. Throw on a Surprise Attack mod, and Mechaneers Tricksleeves for a Hunter and in the right circumstances you can get down to a 0.27s TTK with three crits. Recommended MW: Stability, with an Icarus Grip, if you're leaning into an aerial playstyle, or Targeting Adjuster, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod depending on your preference. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2387244414,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=1840239774,1885400500,2387244414,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=4090651448,1885400500,2387244414,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=1392496348,1885400500,2450788523,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2450788523,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=1840239774,1885400500,2450788523,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2566006935&perks=4090651448,1885400500,2450788523,2610012052

// Fioritura-59 (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Hipfire Grip, Offhand Strike
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 291 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Suros Synergy is one of the most useful PvP perks, boosting handling and reducing flinch after a reload. Rapid-fire sidearms have a competitive out-of-the-box TTK of 0.6s (6c, 1b) and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.8s (3c, 4b) within their range. In-band stats, but with a standout Airborne Effectiveness of 23. Sidearm ranges are highly compressed, so boost stability with your barrel and mag instead to make crits easier. You can save the time of ADSing and go all into hipfire with Hipfire Grip in the first trait column and Offhand Strike in the second, and then complete the build with a Freehand Grip mod. Throw on a Surprise Attack mod, and Mechaneers Tricksleeves for a Hunter and, in the right circumstances you can get down to a 0.4s TTK with one crit and three body shots. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Freehand Grip mod, or an Icarus Grip mod, if you're leaning into an aerial playstyle. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

@title:Season 19 Deep Stone Crypt raid weapons
@description:Reprised DSC Raid weapons with the Bray Inheritance origin perk

// Posterity (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Voltshot, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for arc synergy and end-game content. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Who would have thought that the hottest property from DSC would be a precision hand cannon? Stats are good by comparison with competitors. Fluted Barrel makes it feel snappier and Tactical Mag adds couple of extra bullets and stability. Unusually, Voltshot rolls in the first trait column and is the runaway best option for add clear, and using Frenzy as a second damage perk also boosts handling and reload to 100 so you can proc Voltshot's jolt as fast as possible after a kill, which will also stun Overload champions from Lightfall (Season 20) onwards. Just chef's kiss good. Recommended MW: Range, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3281285075&perks=1840239774,106909392,2173046394,4104185692

// Posterity (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, (Rapid Hit, Surplus, Reconstruction), Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Precision HCs aren't the best choice for PvE as at v6.3.0.7, but just in case they ever get at little love, this might be worth tucking away. Stats are good by comparison with competitors. Fluted Barrel makes it feel snappier and Tactical Mag adds couple of extra bullets and stability. For end-game add clear, Reconstruction can double the size of your magazine, or Rapid Hit or Surplus and Frenzy between them can passively max out stability, handling and reload speed and add 15% damage. Recommended MW: Range, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Trustee (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and end-game content. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats by comparison with other rapid-fire scouts, and there are a couple of ways to go with your roll. The first thing to do is sort out the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, which also helps handling a bit. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell add stability and reload speed (and an extra bullet for Tac Mag). Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion layers more stability and reload speed - stability is good to help stay on a crit spot. Incandescent is great for add clear and hits your solar verbs. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Trustee (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Puglist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for melee builds. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats by comparison with other rapid-fire scouts, and there are a couple of ways to go with your roll. The first thing to do is sort out the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, which also helps handling a bit. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell add stability and reload speed (and an extra bullet for Tac Mag). For melee builds, Pugilist and Swashbuckler are the natural choice - get a melee kill for a refreshable 33% damage boost, and then each hit regenerates a little melee energy from the origin trait, while each kill regenerates a full 10%. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,106909392,691659142,4082225868

// Trustee (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Reconstruction, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats by comparison with other rapid-fire scouts, and there are a couple of ways to go with your roll. The first thing to do is sort out the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, which also helps handling a bit. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell add stability and reload speed (and an extra bullet for Tac Mag). For end-game use, Reconstruction overfills your magazine by 100%, so if you hit 9 crits, you have 11 seconds (12s when enhanced) to use the 27 remaining shots with Focused Fury's 20% damage boost. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1392919471&perks=839105230,106909392,1523832109,2896038713

// Succession (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Extended Mag, Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag), Reconstruction, (Firing Line, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Pretty much best in-subfamily stats, but any kinetic sniper has to offer a lot to stand out from the crowd. If you decide this is for you, the best rolls are more for burst damage against majors and stunned Champions. Fluted Barrel adds handling and stability, or go all-in to stability with Polygonal Rifling. You can use Tactical Mag to add stability and reload speed, Alloy Mag to help with reloads on an empty mag, or maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag. For Majors, Reconstruction will double your magazine size (so you can get up to 10 in the mag with Extended Mag and a Backup Mag mod). If you're in a group, Firing Line provides a passive 20% bonus crit damage in a fireteam or, if you're running solo, Focused Fury can proc after three crit his, so your remaining shots have 20% bonus damage. Recommended MW: Handling or stability, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Heritage (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), Reconstruction, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Great kinetic slug shotgun - good stats across the board. While they're no longer the pillar for majors and boss damage they once were, they still work well as a weapon to swap to for burst or sustained damage. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore are your barrel choices for extra stability with a side order of handling or range depending on your preference. Assault Mag's increased fire rate is effectively a 7.7% boost to DPS, or Tactical Mag lets you get to the maximum of 8 in the mag with a Backup Mag mod. Reconstruction overfills your magazine to double size which means you only need to hit three or four crits, depending on how close you get to the magazine limit, for 11s (12s with the Enhanced Perk) for a 20% damage boost for the remainder of the magazine with Focused Fury. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1840239774,791862061,1523832109,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1482024992,791862061,1523832109,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1840239774,106909392,1523832109,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1482024992,106909392,1523832109,2896038713

// Heritage (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for melee builds in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Great kinetic slug shotgun - good stats across the board. While they're no longer the pillar for majors and boss damage they once were, they still work well as a weapon to swap to for burst or sustained damage. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore are your barrel choices for extra stability with a side order of handling or range depending on your preference. Assault Mag's increased fire rate is effectively a 7.7% boost to DPS, or Tactical Mag lets you get to the maximum of 8 in the mag with a Backup Mag mod. or melee builds, Pugilist and Swashbuckler are the natural choice - get a melee kill for a refreshable 33% damage boost, and then each hit regenerates a little melee energy from the origin trait, while each kill regenerates a full 20%. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1840239774,791862061,691659142,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1482024992,791862061,691659142,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1840239774,106909392,691659142,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=4248569242&perks=1482024992,106909392,691659142,4082225868

// Commemoration (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Tactical, Appended or Extended Mag. Killing Tally is the easiest to proc damage boosting perk if you're killing adds - 3 kills equals 30% bonus damage until you stow or reload, which you won't have to do much with Subsistence refreshing your magazine, so you could keep firing until you're empty. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Commemoration (PvE first-choice roll)
// // (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), (Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm), Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst or sustained majors or boss damage in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Appended or Extended Mag, reload speed with Flared Magwell or Alloy Mag, or both with Tactical Mag. If you're focusing on one target for damage, Reconstruction overflows your mag to doble size, or Fourth Time's the Charm can keep you topped up against a big boss crit, while Firing Line boosts damage by 20% when you're in a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Commemoration (PvE first-choice roll)
// // (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), (Subsistence, Fourth Times The Charm, Reconstruction, Rapid Hit, Feeding Frenzy), Rampage
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Appended or Extended Mag, reload speed with Flared Magwell or Alloy Mag, or both with Tactical Mag. For add clear, you need a reload perk or mag extending perk in your first trait column - Subsistence, Fourth Times The Charm, Reconstruction, Rapid Hit or Feeding Frenzy all work with good old Rampage to boost damage by up to 33%. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Commemoration (PvE first-choice roll)
// // (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Dragonfly, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Appended or Extended Mag, reload speed with Flared Magwell or Alloy Mag, or both with Tactical Mag. For a fun add-clear option in crowds, pair Dragonfly with Killing Tally. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Bequest (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. For add clear, Unrelenting keeps your health up while Chain Reaction helps clear crowds, with kills counting towards Unrelenting too. Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3366545721&perks=3666208348,269888150,3108830275,2396489472

// Bequest (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for major or boss damage in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. For major or boss damage in a crowd - think Duality - Relentless Strikes returns ammo for every three hits, and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% (47% for the Enhanced Park. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3366545721&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3708227201

// Bequest (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Thresh, Unrelenting), Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for melee or grenade builds. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits (the amount depends on the weapon archetype). The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. You can build into the origin perk benefits - 2% to all abilities on a hit, with either Thresh or Wellspring in the first trait column and Demolitionist in the second. Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
